info.description: Agilit-e enables you to centralize your business logic and processes and expose them as microservices to new or existing applications. With the Agilit-e connector, you gain access to many services including Business Process Management (BPM), Roles, Keywords, Templates and more.
info.title: Agilite

additionalMessages.description: List of additional messages that could be returned related to the failed response

description.description: A short description explaining the Process Step

duration.description: The SLA Duration in hours. Provide a value of 0 if not applicable

eventStamp.description: An Event Stamp for the current Process Step

instructions.description: Instructions to Responsible User during Step

key.description: A unique key to identify the Process Step

name.description: A short name for the Process Step

processKey.description: A unique key to identify the BPM Profile

processStage.description: A key that defines the Process Stage of the current Step

responsibleRole.description: The role responsible for the current Process Step

responsibleUsers.description: The users responsible for the current Process Step

description.description: A short description explaining the Step Option

eventStamp.description: An Event Stamp for the current Step Option

name.description: A short name for the Step Option

nextStep.description: The next step the business process will be routed to. Leave empty if no further steps

id.description: The id of the component that gets referenced in the UI

label.description: A label defining the input field or editable component

messages.description: Messages to be used when Input Options validation fails

type.description: Defines the type of input field or editable component to be used

isEditable.description: Is the component referenced editable for user input

isMandatory.description: Does the component referenced require user input

optionSelected.description: The option selected when actioning the BPM record

submissionDate.description: The date/time the BPM record was actioned

toProcessStage.description: The Process stage for the BPM record at the time of the History entry

toStepName.description: The Name of the Process Step for the BPM record at the time of the History entry

post.description: Submits an option in its current workflow step. Depending on the business rules, the record wil be progressed to the next step in the process and return information about the next step to the calling api

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: process-key

parameters.description: Identifies the record that is being submitted. The id is registered by the registerBPMRecord api for new records and can be found in the recordID property of the BPM api responses
parameters.name: bpm-record-id

parameters.description: Identifies the option that is selected by the user to be executed as part of the submission process. This value has to correspond with a valid step option in the workflow profile
parameters.name: option-selected

parameters.description: The email address of the user that is submitting the BPM step. This will typically be the user that is logged in at the time of calling the api
parameters.name: current-user

parameters.description: Passes comments to the execution process which will be stamped into the workflow history. This would typically be used if the user is rejecting a step, or requesting more information
parameters.name: comments

parameters.description: Additional Properties
parameters.name: properties

get.description: Get the full BPM Profile with configuration and options for the process.

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

post.description: Get BPM Record State for one or more records to include the current status, who is responsible for the record, the workflow history and other information to describe the current state and rules for the record

parameters.description: Filter to identify the business process(es) that records will be returned for. This key can be found on the BPM profile in the Agilit-e Admin Portal - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: process-keys

parameters.description: filter to only return records with specific recordIds. The recordId is registered by the registerBPMRecord api for new records and can be found in the recordID property of the BPM api responses - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: bpm-record-ids

parameters.description: Filter to only return records that are currently to the specified workflow step(s) - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: step-names

parameters.description: Filter to only return records that are currently assigned to the specified email address(es) - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: responsible-users

parameters.description: Filter to only return records that are relevant to the specified email address(es) - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: relevant-users

parameters.description: Specify if the history object should be returned with the record state information
parameters.name: include-history

parameters.description: Specify if the step options object should be returned with the record state information
parameters.name: include-step-options

parameters.description: Specify if the visible objects object should be returned with the record state information
parameters.name: include-visible-objects

get.description: Register new BPM Record. The record is assigned with a recordID that is used for the record life cycle to identify the record, it's progress, history and status at all time

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: process-key

parameters.description: The email address of the user that is registering the record. This will typically be the user that is logged in at the time of calling the api
parameters.name: current-user

get.description: Returns Key/Value pairs of a specific Keyword profile based on the 'profile-key' provided

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

parameters.description: An optional parameter to sort the returned Key/Value result
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Format the output of the returned result
parameters.name: output-format

get.description: Returns a Keyword Label based on the 'profile-key' and 'value-key' provided

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

parameters.description: The Value key in the Label/Value listing for the targeted profile
parameters.name: value-key

parameters.description: Format the output of the returned result
parameters.name: output-format

get.description: Returns all Keyword profile keys based on the 'group-name' provided

parameters.description: The Group name used to group Keyword profiles
parameters.name: group-name

parameters.description: An optional parameter to sort the returned Key/Value result
parameters.name: sort

get.description: Returns a Keyword Value based on the 'profile-key' and 'label-key' provided

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

parameters.description: The Label key in the Label/Value listing for the targeted profile
parameters.name: label-key

parameters.description: Format the output of the returned result
parameters.name: output-format

post.description: Generates a unique number based on 'profile-key' provided

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

parameters.description: Format the output of the returned result
parameters.name: output-format

parameters.description: Additional Properties
parameters.name: properties

get.description: Assign user specified role that is applicable to a specific record. An example of this would be a document reviewer or a leave approver

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: process-key

parameters.description: Identifies the record that the role is being set for. The id is registered by the registerBPMRecord api for new records and can be found in the recordID property of the BPM api responses
parameters.name: bpm-record-id

parameters.description: The email address of the user that is setting the role. This will typically be the user that is logged in at the time of calling the api
parameters.name: current-user

parameters.description: The name of the role that is being assigned. E.g Approver or Reviewer
parameters.name: role-name

parameters.description: The email addresses of the users who is assigned to this role - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: responsible-users

get.description: Get responsible person(s) for previously assigned role for a specific record

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: process-key

parameters.description: Identifies the record that the role is being set for. The id is registered by the registerBPMRecord api for new records and can be found in the recordID property of the BPM api responses
parameters.name: bpm-record-id

parameters.description: The Role(s) to be queried (separate using commas)
parameters.name: role-names

post.description: Get responsible person(s) that are assigned to roles in the Agilit-e admin portal. These roles are not only relevant to specific records or business processes and are more typically used for company wide roles in the organization

parameters.description: Specify the role name(s) that you want to retrieve the responsible users for - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: role-names

parameters.description: Specify additional levels that can be used to determine the correct person for the role. An example of a level might be a department name (if you want to retrieve the Department Manager), or a product name (if you want to retrieve the Product Manager) - (separate using commas)
parameters.name: conditional-levels

post.description: Processes and returns a Template from Agilit-e based on the 'profile-key' provided

parameters.description: Unique Key for the targeted profile
parameters.name: profile-key

parameters.description: Format the output of the returned result
parameters.name: output-format

parameters.description: Additional Properties
parameters.name: properties
